title: Is the iPhone 12 Mini what those who wanted a smaller iPhone were calling for? - Quora

response.answer_text: The iPhone 12 Mini is certainly a compelling phone. The original iPhone SE — basically an iPhone 5 with a 4″ screen but technology two generations newer, introduced a half-year after the iPhone 6S at a bargain price — was 123.8 x 58.6 x 7.6 mm and weighed 113 grams. The 2020 iPhone SE — basically an iPhone 8 with a 4.7″ screen but technology two generations newer, introduced a half-year after the iPhone 11 at a bargain price — is 138.4 x 67.3 x 7.3 mm and weighs 149 grams. It was the “spiritual successor” to the original iPhone SE, and tens of millions of people who wanted a cheaper iPhone, smaller than most other iPhones (if still markedly bigger than the original iPhone SE) bought it. But this year’s iPhone SE really offered very little over the iPhone 8 except for a years-newer, faster CPU. So there were people who wanted an iPhone that was small, but not merely a speed-bumped version of an old model. That market niche hadn’t really been addressed by Apple before — there was always a correlation between “smaller screen” and “lower price.” The iPhone 12 mini is clearly aimed at that niche. In terms of size and weight, it’s bigger than the original iPhone SE but smaller than the 2020 iPhone SE, coming in at 131.5 x 64.2 x 7.4 mm and weighing 135 grams. But there’s no old technology to be found. Its 5.4-inch display is larger than that of the 2020 SE, and it has twice the pixel density of older iPhones, for a 2340x1080 display. It’s also OLED instead of IPS LCD. It’s got the latest CPU, dual cameras, 5G including mmWave, Face ID, 6-meter water resistance, 30fps HDR video recording, 1080p FaceTime calling… yeah, lots of goodies in a small package. So for those who wanted an iPhone that’s small but also completely cutting-edge, the iPhone 12 mini is certainly what they were calling for.

I think it is. It’s even closer to the iPhone 5/5S/SE design and dimensions than I expected. When they introduced the iPhone X, which was roughly the size of the iPhone 6/6s etc but all screen, the first thing I thought was “I hope they do it to the SE”. It’s remarkably close to it now. Now the thing is, it’s also much more expensive than the original iPhone SE was. In fact it’s almost twice as expensive. So that may hold people off but I believe it’s the closest we’ll get for the time being, as I don’t believe they’ll touch the iPhone SE anytime soon.
